definition: to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.
sentences.chinese: 凡經過的人都必搖手嗤笑她。

sentences.english: She has a habit of waving her hand around --do you know?
sentences.chinese: 你知道她有個搖手的習慣嗎？

sentences.english: Nestled inside a wooden bucket, there's a metal canister with a hand crank on top.
sentences.chinese: 內置木桶，頂部是一個金屬的曲柄搖手。

sentences.english: They will just wave "good-bay" to the whole group.
sentences.chinese: 他們對整個團體只搖手說“再見”。

definition: to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
sullen/to scowl miserably
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to mediate/to broker a compromise
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to shiver
helter-skelter
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
constable
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to keep silent
swaggering/staggering/waddling
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
